page.title: 06Verwood Church School.
page.content: Verwood C.E.School was opened in its present premises in 1847.Before this date a school had been held in the adjacent church,'St. Michael and All Angels' for children of the poor. The building was of red brick with a gabled roof and had two connected schoolrooms,(each 6m by 5.5m).These were to cater for 120 children aged from 5 to 8. A four roomed Teacher's house was joined to the school via a lobby.The teacher was to be paid Â£20 a year , suplimented by the children's school fees-a halfpenny a week or sixpence a quarter. The cost of the school building was Â£220,exclusive of the land,which was given for this purpose by Squire Fryer,a local land owner.
